channel.title: Perl
channel.description:
So I've been going through my perl book, and was working on arrays.
[code=perl](79,000..40,000) = $SalaryRange;
print "random('$SalaryRange');"[/code]
I was wondering if this would work for printing random salary ranges from 79,000-40,000.

item.title: Perl
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

you can try ideone.

Read full topic

item.title: Perl
item.dc:creator: @Xellium Xellium
item.description:
@Xellium wrote:

[quote=“s1gma, post:4, topic:463591”][quote author=Xellium link=topic=567121.msg4121741#msg4121741 date=1349818973]

no? for a start, why don’t you actually try it yourself

[code=perl]#!/usr/bin/perl

@SalaryRange = (40000 … 79000);
print $SalaryRange[rand(@SalaryRange)] . “\n”;
[/code]

I was at school when I wrote it. I was looking through my book.
[/quote]http://codepad.org/ altho it’s broke atm[/quote]

Yeah I was using scriptedit.net, but it wasn’t letting me save and compile.

Read full topic
